page.title: 16DISUSED RAILWAYS
page.content: DISUSED RAILWAYS The disused railway line which runs through the area was closed down by Dr. Beeching about 14 years ago. It has a gravel bottom and is becoming a dumping ground for rubbish and litter. It is used by local people and children as a short cut to the shopping precinct at Walkden. Some of the residents feel it is becoming an eyesore and a danger. They feel that with a little work better use could be made of the area as a recreational facility. The original station site was near to where the Ellesmere public house now stands. The railways were originally needed to transport goods to and from industrial Manchester. However, with the decline of the area industrially, we have inherited the legacy. BY MARK JONES AND DEREK TONGE
